title: Fix confusing method name in Classes & Constructor
body:
Why? The method in the current example is called `pop()` but it actually implements an [Array.prototype.shift()](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/shift) method which is confusing for no good reason. It just does it on the wrong side of an array.

I understand the change clutters the example code a bit, but at least it's less confusing.

Another approach--probably a better one--would be to change the name of the method from `pop` to `dequeue` leaving the implementation as is. The `peek` name and implementation could be left as is too then.

title: Add section about not spreading props
[guide] Use HTTPS for links to ESLint documentation
body:
The result of a `s_http://eslint\.org_https://eslint\.org_g`.

Avoids the HTTP 301s of the non-HTTPS URLs.

title: [guide] Fix a link, add an anchor
[doc] add eslint rule reference for `no-new-wrappers`
body: also add a bad example of string casting

title: Added anti-pattern example for Props Naming rule, changed className props in examples
body:
- Added anti-pattern example for **Props Naming** rule with using `className `
- To be consistent with **Props Naming** rule changed `className `to `variant` props in others examples

title: Enables eslint rule: nonblock-statement-body-position
body: Enables [nonblock-statement-body-position](https://eslint.org/docs/rules/nonblock-statement-body-position) eslint rule and adds the link to the related guide section.

title: [doc] Fix a numeration typo in README.md
Add symbol to list of primitives
Changes the eslint `no-mixed-operators` rule to only warn on mixing `**` and `%` with arithmetic operators
Fix markdown style breaking
body:
It came from the special characters "M-BM-":

``` bash
diff README.md README.md.new | cat -A
651c651$
<     const foo = function uniqueMoreDescriptiveLexicalFoo() {$
---$
>  M-BM-  M-BM- const short = function longUniqueMoreDescriptiveLexicalFoo() {$
```

title: Add AngularJS section
body:
Add AngularJS section

This section outlines style guidelines that can't really be enforced by
eslint, but would encourage consistency throughout our codebase.

Other changes:
  - Updated all examples to be internally consistent with our style guide
    - 4-space indentation
    - function isolation
    - etc.

title: To Clarify the func-style description
body:
As "foo" is still meaningless, but with "short", we can see that, we are intend to use a short alias name to make our coding happily.

refer to https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/issues/794

title: Clarify reasoning for named function expressions
body:
For convenience, added brief explanations that are given in the linked
discussion — #794 — mostly eliminating the need to scroll through the comments.

title: Add clarification to arrow functions
body:
Clarify and correct explanation — to be consistent with section 7.1 (use
named function expressions).
